I200406110010, Linux 2.6.4, GTK+ 2.4.1, KDE 3.2.2 
 
I was making changes to a file, and then the screen stopped repainting.  
Checking my log I several occurrences of the following exception.  The window 
could still be closed (using the "X" in the top right).  However, the modified 
contents of the file were not saved (even though I was prompted to save them, 
and said yes).  This caused lost work. 
 
I have no clear steps to reproduce, but this bug causes data loss.  Marking as 
critical. 
 
 
 
java.lang.NullPointerException 
	at 
org.eclipse.jface.text.projection.ProjectionTextStore.get(ProjectionTextStore.java:149) 
	at 
org.eclipse.jface.text.AbstractDocument.get(AbstractDocument.java:896) 
	at 
org.eclipse.jface.text.DefaultDocumentAdapter.doGetLine(DefaultDocumentAdapter.java:127) 
	at 
org.eclipse.jface.text.DefaultDocumentAdapter.getLine(DefaultDocumentAdapter.java:135) 
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.redrawLines(StyledText.java:5887) 
	at 
org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.internalRedrawRange(StyledText.java:4845) 
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.redrawRange(StyledText.java:6026)

I believe I have a reproducible test case.  There may be steps missing from 
this, but I believe it is as simple as: 
1.) Open a file. 
2.) Select some text with the mouse. 
3.) Type some letters using the keyboard. 
 
Some of the editor will turn white (blank), and then everything stops 
responding.

I just tried to reproduce on a second machine, but could not.  Either my 
workspace is corrupted somehow, or there is something particular about my 
set-up.
